data.title: Smallest Goldbach deviation
data.statement:
The Goldbach conjecture is the claim that every even integer greater than 2 can be written as the sum of two prime numbers.

Supposing that this is true, find when it's possible the 2 prime numbers that the given number [[n]] is the sum of,  having the smallest deviation.
When it's not possible, print {{OUTSIDE OF GOLDBACH}}

<<Example :>> 38 get these 2 possible sums
38 = 7 + 31
38 = 19 + 19
31 - 7 = 24 > 19 - 19 = 0; so the result is <<"19 19">>
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> An integer [[n]], the number for which the 2 prime factors with the smallest deviation must be found.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> Two space separated integers in descending order.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The Goldbach conjecture is the claim that every even integer greater than 2 can be written as the sum of two prime numbers.

Supposing that this is true, find when it's possible the 2 prime numbers that the given number n is the sum of, having the smallest deviation.
When it's not possible, print OUTSIDE OF GOLDBACH

Example : 38 get these 2 possible sums
38 = 7 + 31
38 = 19 + 19
31 - 7 = 24 > 19 - 19 = 0; so the result is "19 19"
Input
Line 1 : An integer n, the number for which the 2 prime factors with the smallest deviation must be found.
Output
Line 1: Two space separated integers in descending order.
Constraints
2 < n < 1000
Example
Input
38
Output
19 19
